intro: Rubus thyrsoideus f. pulcherrimus, commonly known as the showy blackberry. This plant is a cultivated form of the common blackberry, characterized by its striking, pinkish-white flowers that appear in early summer. It produces dark purple berries that are typically smaller than those of the standard species. The plant is shrub-like, with thorny stems and trifoliate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
